title: Bhandardara: Maharashtra's Hidden Gem for Nature Lovers

content.text: Bhandardara is a serene hill station in Ahmednagar district, located at an elevation of about 750 meters. Known for its lakes, waterfalls, dams, and surrounding Sahyadri ranges, it offers a peaceful retreat away from crowded tourist destinations.
The region is named 'Bhandardara', meaning 'treasure of valuables', reflecting its rich natural resources and scenic beauty including Arthur Lake, Wilson Dam, Randha Falls, and ancient temples.

Arthur Lake, formed by the Wilson Dam on the Pravara River, is surrounded by green hills and provides opportunities for boating, photography, and lakeside walks with spectacular sunrise and sunset views.
Built in 1910, Wilson Dam is one of India's oldest dams. During monsoon, the overflowing water creates a dramatic waterfall effect, while the dam top offers panoramic views of the lake and valley.
Randha Falls, also called Umbrella Falls, cascades from a height of about 170 feet and is best seen during the monsoon season when the Pravara River is in full flow.
Bhandardara whispers what the busy world has forgotten â€“ that nature's simplicity holds profound beauty and peace.
content.author: Travel Philosopher

content.text: Lakeside camping, bonfires, and clear night skies make Bhandardara ideal for stargazing, especially with minimal light pollution.
Monsoon and post-monsoon months offer lush greenery and waterfalls, while winter provides pleasant weather for sightseeing and camping.
